intro: Cadetia ceratostyloides, commonly known as the horned-stemmed cadetia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with a distinctive, branched stem that resembles horns, giving it its common name. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
